That's kind of tricky, as it involves the splintering of the Shinsengumi. 
But the main body stuck with Kondou and Hijikata, and swelled to just about 
300, I think...and when they were training at Nagareyama, I think, they were 
spotted by advance forces of the "Imperial" army. Kondou was running 
operations for the Koyochinbutai (Shinsengumi-like unit serving the Shogun) 
at the time, and that's when he was captured. Hijikata, under the pseudonym 
Naito Hayato, tried to sneak a rescue attempt, but ultimately failed. Kondou 
was beheaded, his head was displayed in Kyoto (I think), and then the rest 
of the Shinsengumi retreated with Hijikata and Saitou to Aizu.

Momoiro-usagi-san, is this correct?

--M.
